text:
A heavy dray horse passed by. 

“Hey there, German hatter!” 

The young man froze. He clutched his worn-out hat. 

“It’s absurd,” he muttered, panic rising. “This hat will ruin everything.” 

He felt terror, not shame. 

“Trifles always ruin everything,” he whispered. 

He counted his steps to the lodging house: seven hundred thirty. 

He remembered dreaming of daring exploits. 

Now, he faced a choice.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The young man is consumed by anxiety over his conspicuous hat, fearing it could jeopardize his carefully planned actions.
